https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk7-scala2.10/3711/
Test PASSed (JDK 7 and Scala 2.10).
Hear, hear! All tests in green. It seems that @enothereska appearance chased away those flaky tests 😄

@mjsax Addressed most of the review comments.
Some changes are still left, as they are done to make dry-run output look cleaner.
Below is the dry run output
bin/kafka-streams-application-reset.sh --input-topics streams-file-input,t1,t9 --zookeeper localhost:2181 --dry-run

----Dry run displays the actions which will be performed when running Streams Reset Tool----
Following input topics offsets will be reset to beginning (for consumer group streams-wordcount)
Topic: streams-file-input
Following internal topics offsets will be reset to beginning (for consumer group streams-wordcount)
Topic: streams-wordcount-Counts-repartition
Topic: streams-wordcount-Counts-changelog
Following input topics are not found, skipping them
Topic: t1
Topic: t9
Done.
Following internal/auto-created topics will be Deleted for application streams-wordcount
Topic: streams-wordcount-Counts-repartition
Topic: streams-wordcount-Counts-changelog
Done.

And regarding cleanup for resetting offsets for internal topics, will be done as part of this JIRA 	KAFKA-5210. Once this PR is delivered in.
Please let me know any more changes needed.

With this change, in line 389 we can now get rid of `new HashSet<>(openIterators)` with `openIterators` itself right?

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk8-scala2.12/3719/
Test PASSed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.12).

Unfortunately, `SynchronizedSet` requires you to manually synchronize when iterating.  See https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/Collections.html#synchronizedSet(java.util.Set)

In Java 8 we have `ConcurrentSet` which gets rid of this restriction.  But we're stuck with Java 7 for now :(

Let me actually make sure that we're synchronizing on the set when loading the HashMap...
